definitions.text: a principle or condition that customarily governs behavior
examples: it was his rule to take a walk before breakfast
short haircuts were the regulation

definitions.text: something regarded as a normative example
examples: the convention of not naming the main character
violence is the rule not the exception
his formula for impressing visitors

definitions.text: prescribed guide for conduct or action
(linguistics) a rule describing (or prescribing) a linguistic practice
a basic generalization that is accepted as true and that can be used as a basis for reasoning or conduct
examples: their principles of composition characterized all their works

definitions.text: the duration of a monarch's or government's power
examples: during the rule of Elizabeth

definitions.text: dominance or power through legal authority
examples: France held undisputed dominion over vast areas of Africa
the rule of Caesar

definitions.text: directions that define the way a game or sport is to be conducted
examples: he knew the rules of chess

definitions.text: any one of a systematic body of regulations defining the way of life of members of a religious order
examples: the rule of St. Dominic

definitions.text: a rule or law concerning a natural phenomenon or the function of a complex system
examples: the principle of the conservation of mass
the principle of jet propulsion
the right-hand rule for inductive fields

definitions.text: (mathematics) a standard procedure for solving a class of mathematical problems
examples: he determined the upper bound with Descartes' rule of signs
he gave us a general formula for attacking polynomials

definitions.text: measuring stick consisting of a strip of wood or metal or plastic with a straight edge that is used for drawing straight lines and measuring lengths
exercise authority over; as of nations
examples: Who is governing the country now?
The King decreed that all firstborn males should be killed

definitions.text: be larger in number, quantity, power, status or importance
examples: Money reigns supreme here
Hispanics predominate in this neighborhood

definitions.text: decide on and make a declaration about
examples: find someone guilty

definitions.text: have an affinity with; of signs of the zodiac
mark or draw with a ruler
examples: rule the margins
rule one's temper
